title: Opposition and Completion
shortSummary: Nehemiah 6 details the persistent opposition faced by Nehemiah and the Israelites as they rebuild Jerusalem’s wall. Despite threats, deception, and intimidation, Nehemiah remains steadfast, completing the wall in just 52 days, demonstrating God’s providence and the power of faithful perseverance.
timeline: c. 445 BC - Rebuilding of Jerusalem’s Wall under Nehemiah’s leadership

keyCharacters.name: Nehemiah
keyCharacters.description: The governor of Judah who leads the rebuilding of Jerusalem’s wall and resists enemy opposition through faith and discernment.

keyCharacters.name: Sanballat
keyCharacters.description: An adversary of Nehemiah, a leader who repeatedly tries to intimidate and deceive Nehemiah to stop the rebuilding.

keyCharacters.name: Tobiah
keyCharacters.description: An enemy allied with Sanballat who uses intimidation and political influence to oppose Nehemiah and the Jews.

keyCharacters.name: Geshem the Arabian
keyCharacters.description: Another enemy who collaborates with Sanballat and Tobiah in attempts to hinder the rebuilding effort.

keyCharacters.name: Shemaiah
keyCharacters.description: A prophet who falsely warns Nehemiah to hide in the temple, but is revealed to be hired by Nehemiah’s enemies to cause fear and sin.

definitions.definition: A fertile plain near Jerusalem, used here as a proposed meeting place by Nehemiah’s enemies intending harm.
A false prophetess mentioned as part of those who sought to intimidate Nehemiah and undermine his work.
The twelfth month of the Hebrew calendar, corresponding roughly to August-September, marking the completion of the wall.
A publicly displayed or widely circulated letter intended to spread false accusations and sow distrust.

outline.heading: Enemy Attempts to Intimidate Nehemiah
outline.description: Sanballat, Tobiah, and Geshem try multiple times to lure Nehemiah into a meeting to harm him, but he wisely refuses, recognizing their evil intentions.

outline.heading: False Accusations and Propaganda
outline.description: Nehemiah receives a forged letter accusing him of rebellion and ambition to be king, but he denies these lies and prays for God’s strength amid intimidation.

outline.heading: Deception Through False Prophecy
outline.description: Shemaiah attempts to frighten Nehemiah into hiding in the temple, but Nehemiah discerns the deception and refuses to sin, exposing the plot against him.

outline.heading: Completion of the Wall
outline.description: Despite opposition, the wall is finished in 52 days, causing fear and discouragement among the enemies who recognize God’s hand in the work.

outline.heading: Political Intrigue and Correspondence
outline.description: Some nobles in Judah maintain secret alliances with Tobiah, exchanging letters and information, but Nehemiah remains vigilant against these internal threats.

application: Remain steadfast in your God-given tasks despite opposition or intimidation, trusting God to strengthen your hands.
Discern and reject false counsel or deception that seeks to lead you away from obedience to God’s will.
Pray earnestly for protection and wisdom when facing spiritual and external attacks.
Celebrate and give thanks to God for His faithfulness when He enables you to complete difficult tasks.

keyVerses.text: And I sent messengers unto them, saying, I am doing a great work, so that I cannot come down: why should the work cease, whilst I leave it, and come down to you?
keyVerses.significance: Nehemiah’s commitment to God’s work teaches the importance of focus and perseverance in ministry despite distractions.

keyVerses.text: For they all made us afraid, saying, Their hands shall be weakened from the work, that it be not done. Now therefore, O God, strengthen my hands.
keyVerses.significance: This verse models prayer for strength in the face of fear and opposition, encouraging believers to rely on God’s power.

keyVerses.text: So the wall was finished in the twenty and fifth day of the month Elul, in fifty and two days.
keyVerses.significance: The rapid completion of the wall demonstrates God’s blessing on faithful labor and the fulfillment of His purposes.

keyVerses.text: And it came to pass, that when all our enemies heard thereof, and all the heathen that were about us saw these things, they were much cast down in their own eyes: for they perceived that this work was wrought of our God.
keyVerses.significance: Recognition that God’s hand is evident in success encourages believers to trust Him as the true source of victory.
